title: bm211-workshops
text:
Preface to the 2023-24 presentation
Welcome to the 2023-24 edition of the BM211 computing workshops.
This is the first presentation of this material in this form, and we would be very grateful to hear feedback by email or through the GitHub repository Issues page.

title: 1  Introduction
text:
This is a book created from markdown and executable code.
See Knuth (1984) for additional discussion of literate programming.

1 + 1

[1] 2






Knuth, Donald E. 1984. “Literate Programming.” Comput. J. 27 (2): 97–111. https://doi.org/10.1093/comjnl/27.2.97.

title: 2  Summary
text:
In summary, this book has no content whatsoever.

1 + 1

[1] 2

title: Workshop 01
text: Our goal in this computational workshop is to introduce some concepts in microbial ecology.

title: Diversity Measures
text: This chapter will introduce the concept of a diversity measure in microbial ecology.

title: Workshop 04
text: Our goal in this workshop is to introduce you to handling and analysing CRISPR-Cas sequence data.

title: PILER-CR
text: This chapter will introduce the software tool PILER-CR, which is designed to predict the location and content of CRISPR repeats in microbial genomes.

title: Workshop 05
text: Our goal in this workshop is to introduce you to producing and interpreting phylogenetic trees.

title: Protein Trees
text: This chapter will guide you through the process of producing a phylogenetic tree from a protein sequence alignment.

title: References
text:
Knuth, Donald E. 1984. “Literate Programming.” Comput.
J. 27 (2): 97–111. https://doi.org/10.1093/comjnl/27.2.97.
